channel.title: BBC News | South Asia | World Edition
channel.description: Get the latest BBC News from South Asia: breaking news, features, analysis and debate plus audio and video coverage from across the South Asia region.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse

item.title: Pakistani offensive 'nears end'
item.description: Pakistan's military offensive against Taliban militants in the Swat valley is nearly over, the defence minister says.

item.title: Indian forces close in on Maoists
item.description: Indian security forces are approaching the area of West Bengal state where Maoist rebels have seized control, officials say.

item.title: Kashmir shuts down over deaths
item.description: A shutdown to protest against the alleged murder of two young women has once again hit Indian-administered Kashmir.

item.title: Bangladesh adopts new time rules
item.description: The Bangladeshi government is introducing daylight saving time in an effort to address power shortages in the country.

item.title: Air raid 'kills nine' in Pakistan
item.description: At least nine people are killed in a suspected US airstrike on militant targets in Pakistan's tribal region of South Waziristan, officials say.

item.title: Jolie and Pitt donate to Pakistan
item.description: Hollywood couple Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt donate a million dollars to help displaced Pakistanis, the UN says.

item.title: US 'to improve' Afghan training
item.description: A US report on airstrikes in Afghanistan calls for better training for US forces to reduce civilian casualties, officials say.

item.title: Clashes flare at Maoist stronghold
item.description: Paramilitary troops are called in after Maoist rebels take control of part of the eastern Indian state of West Bengal.

item.title: Lumley joins Gurkha celebrations
item.description: Actress Joanna Lumley joins thousands of people celebrating the Gurkhas being given the freedom of their Kent base town.

item.title: Look to the future - Punjab trains tech-savvy police
item.description: Police in the Indian state of Punjab receive a 21st Century computerised makeover.

item.title: Afridi steers Pakistan into final
item.description: Shahid Afridi puts in a superb display to help Pakistan beat favourites South Africa and reach the World Twenty20 final.

item.title: Coach Buchanan sacked by IPL team
item.description: Prospective England coach John Buchanan has been sacked by Indian Premier League team Kolkata Knight Riders.

item.title: No respite
item.description: Sri Lanka's war is over but threats to journalists remain

item.title: In pictures
item.description: Famous Delhi coffee house battles to stay open

item.title: Rollercoaster ride
item.description: BBC reporter looks back on four years in Pakistan

item.title: Race problem?
item.description: Indians speak out on racism in Australia

item.title: Far from home
item.description: No hope of a swift return for Pakistan displaced

item.title: Housing hope
item.description: Mumbai drives to build more affordable housing

item.title: India bans mobiles without 'code'
item.description: India's Bharti Airtel resumes talks with South Africa's MTN aimed at forming the world's third largest mobile phone firm.

item.title: New call for S Lanka rights probe
item.description: The Sri Lankan government faces renewed criticism over human rights, with two groups doubting its will to enforce the law.

item.title: Indian inflation turns negative
item.description: Inflation in India has turned negative for the first time in more than 30 years, official figures show.

item.title: Karachi suffers major power cut
item.description: Engineers in the Pakistani city of Karachi are working to restore power supplies after a blackout affects millions.

item.title: Stowaway on UK army bus
item.description: An illegal immigrant is found inside Sandhurst military academy after stowing away on an Army coach travelling from Germany.

item.title: 'Cricket attacker' held in Lahore
item.description: Police in Pakistan arrest one of seven men suspected of attacking Sri Lanka's cricket team in Lahore in March, officials say.

item.title: Tamil protest ends after 73 days
item.description: Protests which saw thousands of people demonstrate over the plight of Tamils in Sri Lanka end after 73 days in London.

item.title: EU gives $100m in aid to Pakistan
item.description: The EU gives $100m to help those displaced by fighting in Pakistan in return for greater efforts against "terrorism".

item.title: Danish troops die in Afghanistan
item.description: Three Danish soldiers are killed by a roadside bomb in the Afghan province of Helmand, military reports say.

item.title: Al-Jazeera Afghan staff set free
item.description: Two journalists for Arabic TV network al-Jazeera are freed two three days after being arrested by Afghan intelligence agents.

item.title: Air India rescue package likely
item.description: The Indian government is likely to bail-out its struggling national carrier Air India, the aviation minister says.

item.title: India Maoist violence escalates
item.description: Three more workers of the ruling Communist Party are killed by suspected Maoist rebels in West Bengal state, Indian police say.

item.title: Pakistan army readies for attack
item.description: Troops amass around Pakistan's tribal district of South Waziristan in readiness for an offensive against the Taliban, officials say.

item.title: Afghan election campaign starts
item.description: Campaigning begins for Afghanistan's August presidential election which pits Hamid Karzai against 40 challengers.

item.title: Indian factory output up in April
item.description: India's industrial output rose unexpectedly in April, figures show, fuelling hopes that a recovery may be in sight.

item.title: Satyam shares rise after profit
item.description: Shares in Satyam, the fraud-hit Indian IT firm, rise for a third consecutive day after figures show it remains in profit.

item.title: Electric dreams in Kabul
item.description: Arrival of electricity transforms life in Kabul

item.title: In pictures: Pakistan's displaced
item.description: the BBC's M Ilyas Khan has just returned from north-west Pakistan where he visited refugee camps housing those displaced by fighting in the Swat valley.

item.title: Securing Pakistan's weapons
item.description: Mark Urban on US efforts to secure Pakistan's weapons

item.title: In pictures: Child workers
item.description: A new UN report released on World Day Against Child Labour warns that the problem is getting worse amid the worldwide economic downturn.

item.title: Kiss and Patel
item.description: The singles club in which all members share a surname

item.title: Peace haven
item.description: Welcome to a quiet corner in Pakistan's troubled northwest

item.title: Helmand at home
item.description: How UK army trains for Afghanistan in rural England

item.title: Afghanistan's looted treasures
item.description: Afghanistan retrieves its looted treasures

item.title: India's dynastic politics
item.description: Dynastic politics is still widespread in Indian life
